messageBody:
On 02/15/2006 10:40 AM, Mark Levison apparently said:
> I've asked to give a unit testing tutorial on very short notice (tomorrow
> afternoon UK time, my last day visiting a remote dev group) and am
> wondering
> what topics do you normally cover when giving a tutorial?
>
> It will be interactive (they will be using their own laptops).
>
> My list so far
> 1) Writing and running your first test case
> 2) Different kinds of assertions (assertEquals, assertSame, notNull, etc)
> 3) Testing for exceptions (including use of the fail() method)
> 4) What to test (all public methods)
> 5) Setup/Tear down methods
> 6) Designing classes for easy testing (decoupled etc.)
> 7) Demonstrate simple Mock objects and make reference to the various mock
> tools (rMock etc)
>
> What else would you cover?
>
> Thanks
> Mark Levison

Mark,

These sound good, but for number 4 above I would emphasize the TDD
approach. If the team isn't already doing TDD this would be a good way
to get them started.

How long is the presentation/class? You could actually run them through
a small app as an exercise: seeing is believing, doing is converting. ;)

--
